thread.title: University of Cincinnati's DT Alex Pace gets local Division I players to watch off to a good start
thread.title_full: University of Cincinnati's DT Alex Pace gets local Division I players to watch off to a good start | cleveland.com

author: Branson Wright, The Plain Dealer
title: University of Cincinnati's DT Alex Pace gets local Division I players to watch off to a good start
text:
CINCINNATI, Ohio - The University of Cincinnati had not defeated Miami in 68 years, and that streak did not appear threatened this year, based on how UC's defense performed in last week's loss to Memphis.
But it was the defense that stepped up in Thursday's 34-23 victory over the Hurricanes at Nippert Stadium. The defense held Miami to just three points in the second half and the pressure applied by the defensive line was a key ingredient to the Bearcats success.
"We won the ballgame on defense in the second half, there's no doubt about that," UC coach Tommy Tuberville said.
Tuberville also praised a defensive line that controlled the line of scrimmage with three and four-man fronts.
Defensive tackle Alex Pace, out of Glenville High School, was consistently disruptive.
"Being disruptive was needed," Pace said. "I tried to be a strong and powerful guy. I used my abilities to bull rush that guard, and make plays on the quarterback in the backfield. They mostly tried to single block me, but it didn't work."
Pace finished with three tackles in the victory. He has 15 tackles in five games.
Winning behind the defense is new to UC. It gives up 30 points and nearly 400 yards per game. One of the biggest disappointments was last week's 53-46 loss to Memphis.
"That was a bad game for us," Pace said. "We bounced back."
Pace is one of many Northeast Ohio natives worth watching in Division I college football. Each Friday, The Plain Dealer will identify some players from this area to watch, then report on Mondays on notable performances.
This week's watch list:
Player: Tyler Orlosky
Position: Center
Year: Junior
College: West Virginia
High School: St. Edward
This week: No. 23 WVU (3-0) plays at No. 15 Oklahoma (3-0).
Last week : Orlosky helped the rushing game gain over 300 yards against Maryland.
Player: Willie Henry
Position: DT
Year: Senior
College: Michigan
High School: Glenville
This week: Henry will help lead Michigan at Maryland. The U-M defense is allowing only 82 yards rushing and and 121.8 yards passing per game.
Last week: Henry had two tackles in Michigan's victory over BYU.
Player: Eddie Daugherty
Position: Wide receiver
Year: Freshman
College: Eastern Michigan
High School: Mentor
This week: Daughtery could have issues against LSU on Saturday.
Last week: Daugherty caught five passes for 109 yards and one TD against Army.
Player: Dorian Baker
Position: Wide receiver
Year: Sophomore
College: Kentucky
High School: Cleveland Heights
This week: Kentucky hosts Eastern Kentucky and expect Baker to shine. Baker leads Kentucky with 16 catches and ranks second on the team with 190 receiving yards.
Last week: Baker had five catches for 51 yards and one TD in a victory over Missouri.
